name: Rational Root Theorem
latex: \text{If } \frac{p}{q} \text{ is a root of } a_n x^n + ... + a_0, \text{ then } p \text{ divides } a_0 \text{ and } q \text{ divides } a_n
explanation: The Rational Root Theorem helps find possible rational roots of a polynomial. If p/q (in lowest terms) is a root, then p must divide the constant term and q must divide the leading coefficient. This narrows down candidates to test, making it easier to factor polynomials and find zeros.

examples.problem: Find possible rational roots of 2x³ - 5x² + x - 1
Test if x = 1/2 is a root of 2x³ - 5x² + x - 1
